wikipedia_page.main: William Norman Mercer (30 May 1922 – 11 April 1989) was an English cricketer active from 1942 to 1956 who played for Sussex. He was born in Prescot, Lancashire and died in Brighton. He appeared in three first-class matches as a righthanded batsman who bowled leg break and googly. He scored 40 runs with a highest score of 24 and took six wickets with a best performance of three for 31.

response: *William Mercer (poet) (c. 1605–c. 1675), Scottish poet and army officer
*William Mercer (rugby league) (born 1906), rugby league footballer of the 1930s for England and St Helens RLFC
*William Mercer (Australian politician) (1796–1871), British Army officer, landowner, pastoralist, and politician in colonial New South Wales
